title: This is what CNN reporter saw inside US air base now under Taliban control
description: CNN's Nic Robertson goes inside an abandoned US air base now under Taliban control and the notorious prison that once held thousands of detainees.

title: Xi vows China will end coal support abroad in major policy shift
Trump put 'America first.' Hear how Biden's UN speech differed
description: In his first speech at the United Nations General Assembly, President Joe Biden promised to work with other countries around the world. See how that compares to former President Donald Trump's "America first" rhetoric in 2017.

title: Family of Harry Dunn reaches a 'resolution' with US diplomat's wife who hit son with car
description: The family of British teenager Harry Dunn, killed in a crash two years ago, has reached a "resolution" in a civil lawsuit against the woman who was charged in his death, the spokesperson for the Dunn family said Tuesday.

title: Superdome in New Orleans catches fire
description: One person was injured in a fire on the roof of the New Orleans' Caesars Superdome Tuesday, authorities said.

title: This lipstick has been around for decades. Now stores can't keep it in stock
description: Clinique's Black Honey lip color launched when Richard Nixon was president, but all these decades later it has gone viral on TikTok. Now, beauty stores and retailers can't keep it on shelves.

title: Canada is back where it started after a bitter pandemic election
description: Justin Trudeau just effectively proved you can win and lose an election at the same time.

title: 1980s news footage goes viral over its shockingly relevant debate
description: CNN's Don Lemon replays footage of Americans sharing their concerns over the seat belt mandate in the 1980s. See how it compares to similar statements made around Covid-19's mask mandate and vaccine distribution.

title: 'Scary': John King reacts to memo from Trump lawyer
description: A two-page memo from former President Trump's attorney John Eastman reveals how they planned to have former Vice President Mike Pence overturn the 2020 election.

title: Texas governor signs bill tightening restrictions on abortion-inducing drugs
description: Abortion-inducing drugs in Texas will now be harder to obtain after the state's Republican governor recently signed restrictive legislation into law, weeks after another strict abortion law went into effect in the state.

title: Four bodies found on Polish-Belarus border as spat over migrant crisis worsens
description: Four people have died on Poland's border with Belarus in recent days, amid accusations that the Belarusian government is funneling migrants to the European Union's eastern border in retaliation over western sanctions.

title: Here's who will be able to get into the US more easily -- and whose trip just got harder
description: Welcome news for millions of travelers arrived on Monday with the announcement of plans to allow fully vaccinated foreign air travelers into the United States starting in early November.

title: Jojo Siwa's same-sex duet makes history on 'Dancing with the Stars'
description: Singer and Nickelodeon star Jojo Siwa had her history-making debut on ABC's "Dancing with the Stars" with the show's first-ever same-sex duet.

title: Why we're all so damn angry
description: The political landscape in America has always been somewhat contentious, but where it stands today is next-level rage. In the latest episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza discusses how Covid-19, election fraud and the overall political sphere has continued to fuel the divide in America today.

title: Why global investors are focused on Evergrande
description: Concerns about potential contagion from Chinese real estate giant Evergrande's debt crisis is shaking markets. CNN's Clare Sebastian reports.

title: How Rudy Giuliani's massive ego saved the country from an utter disaster on election 'fraud'
description: By mid-December 2020, Donald Trump's amen chorus was dwindling, with even many longtime allies suggesting that it might be time to admit defeat in the 2020 election and move on.

title: What we know about Prince Andrew's civil sexual assault case
description: Prince Andrew was served with legal papers in a civil sexual assault case against him when the senior British royal's US-based lawyer was sent the suit by FedEx and email, court papers show. CNN's Anna Stewart reports.

title: Google expands in New York with $2.1 billion office purchase
description: Google is dramatically expanding its office presence in New York City with a $2.1 billion purchase on Manhattan's West Side.

title: Swimming pool and homes swallowed by lava
description: The Cumbre Vieja volcano on Spain's La Palma island erupted on September 19. Authorities say the volcano is expected to continue to spew lava in "the coming days."

title: Aston Martin has a $123,000 James Bond car ... for kids
description: Aston Martin and The Little Car Company have built a very cool and very expensive little James Bond DB5 with toy machine gun headlights.

title: JPMorgan offers Chase accounts to UK consumers in first global move
description: JPMorgan has launched a new digital retail bank in the United Kingdom under its Chase brand, marking its first push into consumer banking outside North America.

title: Video from border shows agents pushing people back on horseback
description: CNN's Rosa Flores visits border town Del Rio, Texas, where thousands of migrants are sleeping in the dirt in huts waiting to get processed by US immigration.

title: Why dinosaurs are weirder than we thought
description: Defined by their disappearance dinosaurs might appear to be evolutionary failures. Not so.

title: How Taiwan's last 'fire fishing' boat is keeping tradition alive
description: As night falls, a group of fishermen set sail off the coast of northern Taiwan, where they prepare to catch sardines with a traditional method: fire.

title: Australia has lost almost a third of its koala population in three years, foundation says
description: Australia has lost about 30% of its koalas over the past three years, with the marsupials hit by drought, bushfires and developers cutting down trees, the Australian Koala Foundation said on Tuesday.
